ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course? (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: A good foundation of American literature, developed skills in reading, analyzing, and discussing literature
I gained deeper reading sills, knowledge of American Literature, and insight into how to be a better writer.
Thinking more critically about American literature and what it means to be American.
An amazing introduction to American literature and literary craft.
This was a great introduction course to English and a great survey of American literature.

I learned an incredible amount about American identity as well as thinking about the methodology of the course: what it means to designate a book as "American", and why the concept of labelling is important. I also got incredible feedback on my writing and analysis, skills I will keep with me throughout my Yale career and beyond.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved? (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Professor Hickey is excellent. She was very thoughtful and deliberate with the books she assigned and how we engaged with them, as well as with the assignments. She edited and adapted assignments and the syllabus as the course went along to help combat our fatigue as students while still promoting the things we were interested in and giving us an opportunity to do deeper analysis through essays and creative projects. She fostered and excellent sense of community that led to engaging and thoughtful discussions. The syllabus was diverse and interesting, especially for a broad literature course. I have no complaints, especially for a required foundational course and writing credit.
Professor Hickey is the absolute best. She is the strength of this course and is so encouraging. The discussions she led and deeper thinking she promoted were amazing. No weaknesses at all.
I can't see any weaknesses in this course! It was very well taught, and the subject matter we covered was carefully and thoughtfully curated.
Prof. Hickey!!! She is the absolute best and if you are going to take this class, take it with her!
The course is well done and well adapted to be as engaging As possible over zoom.

Strengths: Professor Hickey is fantastic. She is incredibly kind and supportive. She allows us to direct the discussion to topics that interest us, and she always enriches our conversations with ideas that make us re-consider certain passages and themes. The literature that we read is also super interesting and diverse. The essays were fun to write because we could pick topics that we found interesting and be creative in our approach. Overall, one of my favorite English classes at Yale!

Weaknesses: None!

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The only issues I had were issues we all had with every class (zoom fatigue, burnout, etc.). I thought in general our discussions were not hindered by the virtual learning.
Everything went as well as it could have. Zoom was a good tool for our discussions.

Professor Hickey was very understanding about the challenges that learning in a pandemic posed for students, and I believe the whole class was grateful for her understanding. We also did a class-wide check-in about how we were each doing for the first 10 or so minutes of class, which really helped create classroom community.
Prof. Hickey made all of the discussions extremely engaging and was very empathetic and kind toward her students. One of the best introductory English seminars.
Breakout rooms and group assignments were great and helped foster a feeling of community.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: If we are talking about this course with Professor Hickey, then absolutely. I would take anything she is teaching. This is one of those courses that is 10000% dependent on your professor and their perspectives and teaching styles. I think in general, it's a good intro course for both English and non-English students.
Yes! I highly recommend with Professor Hickey. She made everything run so well.
Yes, I really think Professor Hickey is a brilliant professor and I would recommend taking any of her classes!
Yes, yes, yes!
Absolutely take this course with Prof Hickey  shes an absolute gem and makes this course shine
Yes this is a great course especially for non humanities majors looking for a writing credit.

I would absolutely recommend this course. Aside from the content, which was always engaging and a pleasure to read (it felt like a break from work!) Professor Hickey was an amazing instructor. I loved how she found ways to adapt to our needs while still giving us a vigorous intellectual experience Professor Hickey's class allowed us to indulge in our love for literature and allowed us to explore it in our own ways. 10/10 would recommend.

Yes definitely!! Professor Hickey is amazing. She is so sweet, supportive, and brilliant as an instructor. Her feedback on essays is always very thorough and helped me improve a lot as a writer. Class discussions were very interesting and thought-provoking. The literature that we read was diverse and introduced me to a wide range of authors, themes, and ideas. Even more importantly, the class genuinely becomes a community and a space where everyone feels comfortable sharing ideas and helping each other better understand the texts. A fantastic class that all Yalies should take!

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Virtual seminar.
